bill.title: Highway Safety; Pilot Program; Photo Red Light Imaging Detector System Program
bill.description: Establishes a three-year pilot photo red light imaging detector system program. Authorizes counties to administer the program. Makes other amendments regarding highway safety. Effective July 1, 2150. Repeals July 1, 2016. (SB693 HD1)

history.action: Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to TIA/PSM/TEC, WAM.
The committee(s) on TIA/PSM/TEC has scheduled a public hearing on 02-11-13 1:16PM in conference room 224.

The committee(s) on TEC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TEC were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Wakai, Nishihara, Gabbard; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Tokuda.

The committee(s) on TIA recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TIA were as follows: 7 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Gabbard; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) English, Kahele, Keith-Agaran, Kouchi, Solomon ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Slom.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 2 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Galuteria, Green.
Reported from TIA/PSM/TEC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 305) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 02-26-13 10:05AM in conference room 211.
The committee(s) on WAM deferred the measure until 02-27-13 9:15AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 9 Aye(s): Senator(s) Ige, Kidani, Chun Oakland, Dela Cruz, Espero, Kahele, Kouchi, Ruderman, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) English, Keith-Agaran, Tokuda.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 728) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 03-05-13.

Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 21; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) English, Kahele, Nishihara, Ruderman, Shimabukuro, Solomon . Noes, 4 (Senator(s) Green, Hee, Taniguchi, Slom). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 194) in amended form (SD 2).
Pass First Reading
Referred to TRN, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 30
Bill scheduled to be heard by TRN on Wednesday, 03-13-13 10:30AM in House conference room 309.

The committees on TRN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Ichiyama, Aquino, Hashem, Ing, Nakashima, Fukumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Takumi, Yamashita.
Reported from TRN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 972) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Evans, Fale, Fukumoto, Hanohano, Johanson, Jordan, McKelvey, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott, Thielen voting no (2) and Representative(s) Mizuno, Oshiro, Takai excused (3).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 03-19-13 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Har, Belatti, Brower, Carroll, Ito, Kawakami, C. Lee, Tsuji, Wooley; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Thielen; 2 Noes: Representative(s) Cabanilla, McDermott; and Excused: none.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1205), recommending referral to FIN.

Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Jordan, Thielen voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Cabanilla, Fale, McDermott voting no (3) and Representative(s) Hanohano, McKelvey, Takumi, Woodson excused (4).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Thursday, 03-28-13 3:15PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Nishimoto, Johanson, Cullen, Hashem, Ing, Kobayashi, Lowen, Morikawa, Onishi, Takayama, Yamashita, Fukumoto, Ward; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Jordan; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Tokioka, Woodson.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1439), recommending passage on Third Reading.

Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Fukumoto, Jordan, McKelvey voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Cabanilla, Fale, McDermott, Thielen voting no (4) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 443).
Deferred until 04-09-13.
Deferred until 04-11-13.
Senate disagrees with House amendments.
Received notice of disagreement (Sen. Com. No. 608).
House conferees appointed: Yamane, Rhoads, Yamashita Co-Chairs; Ichiyama, Cheape.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 699).
